name: Blue Tree Premium Paulista

reviews.text: This was the first time staying at the Blue Tree and I like it. Last year I stayed at Maksoud Plaza and it was nice, but overpriced. Prior to that I stayed at Crowne Plaza which is closed now. My Deluxe room was good size, very clean, comfortable and well maintained. The rate includes breakfast, which was of good quality and had many choices, including Japanese breakfast. The fitness center was one of the best I've seen in Brazil with numerous machines and free weights. I prefer the Paulista area because I can walk around day and night, something you can't do in most of Sao Paolo. I was impressed that this trip there were plenty of police around at night, and I walked to/from dinner. In past trips, I took a taxi on the return.
reviews.title: Good choice for Av. Paulista area!
Room with a view
reviews.text: I was lucky to get one of the corner rooms on the top five floors because they come with a terrace. But, any room above 15 floors is going to get you a wonderful view of the city. I must have taken 50 pictures up there at different times of the day and night due to the rain. The hotel is next to the museum of fine arts on Paulista avenue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner and a couple of friends for two nights. I have to point out that we had an argument at the check-in counter because our room, which had been reserved quite in advance, wouldn't be available for us because the occupying host wanted to stay for longer in our room. After a strong and loud argument the lady at the check-in counter understood that it was not our problem but his. After that everything was ok. Our deluxe room was on the 23rd floor, it had an open city view, a small balcony, a spacious and clean bathroom with all the necessary amenities, a nice sitting area with desk and cosy furnishings, excellent noise-isolation. Breakfast is not excellent but very good. The hotel is located one block off the Avenida Paulista, at a stone-throw from the MASP museum/tube station, and at 15 minutes' walk from the Oscar Freire Street, the top brand shopping street in fashionable Jardins district. Lots of restaurants for all tast and budgets in the nearby. The are is quite safe at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sao Paulo is getting very difficult to find bargins on rooms. I use to stay at the Rennaissance at one time for $150 per night. Due to the devaluation it is not $400. SP is more expensive than NYC. I was staying at the Golden Tupil Paulista and the rooms left a lot to be desired. In my travels I came upon the Blue Tree towers down the road, and checked out the suite. The suite was huge, LR and bedroom, High Def in both rooms and two bathrooms. The rooms had been just updated according to the manger who is a Keneau Reeves look alike. The rooms were excellent, and the beds were fantstic. The breakfas although not up to the Golden Tulip was adquate. This hotel for the price is well worth it considering it is Jardins.
reviews.title: Good location.....tired room

reviews.text: Was passing through because I missed my flight. Booked online through the hotel directly which was more economical than other travel sites. There was some minor renovations underway and the replacement of the hallway carpet sounded like someone kept knocking on my door in the morining. There is a pretty decent workout facility and the pool was nice. Staff was really helpful and the only complaint I have was that after staggering back to the hotel at 5am, the room service I ordered never showed up. It was 5 in the morning so I guess it was a good thing. The restaurant in the hotel was decent at best. The steak I had was tough and all they had were butter knives. But as those who travel to Brasil know, the food is really below mediocre unless you order the traditional Brasilian foods like feijoda or go to a churrasqueria. I would definitely stay here again. Really convenient location to Av. Paulista, Consolacao Metro Station and local airport (Congonhas).

Would recommend to stay in Sao Paulo - its literally a minute away from the Sao Paulo Art Museum and the subway stop right next to it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Received a very warm welcome at reception and were given our keys to a fantastic room on the second top floor that had a balcony and breathtaking views across the city. We had a fantastic buffet dinner at the reception bar for only £4 per head and a great bartender that looked after us very well. Breakfast had a choice of hot food, cereals, dairies and even a Japanese selection.
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a swim in the pool on the first floor the next morning that was a good start to the day. The side walls of the pool area are semi open which allows the fresh air in and there is a glass ceiling which gives the whole area a good open feeling. Next to the pool there is a well appointed gym.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Sao Paulo
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located one block, about three minutes walk, from Paulista Avenue and is only about seven minutes walk away from Museum of Art Sao Paulo (MASP). We found the underground transport system a very efficient and cheap way of moving around the city and there is an underground station very close to the MASP which was ideal for us to get to the bus terminus for the next stage of our vacation when it was time to leave the Blue Tree.

aka: Blue Tree Towers Paulista Hotel Sao Paulo
